definition: to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to dig/to excavate/to scoop out
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to think/to consider

sentences.english: That is a poem full of precious images .
sentences.chinese: 那是盡是挖空心思的意象的詩篇。

sentences.english: He contrived to make a mess of the whole thing。
sentences.chinese: 他挖空心思反而把事情全盤弄糟了。

sentences.english: The king of Jin racked his brains, but could not work out a plan.
sentences.chinese: 晉君挖空心思，也沒能想出個好辦法。

sentences.english: I am sure he is seeking for some jibes .
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定他在想挖空心思苦的話。

sentences.english: Ellie deliberate decision robbery is tasted like the happy life.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉挖空心思的決議強奪品如的幸福生活。

definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to rack one's brains
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means/to try this, that and the other
brains
lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
to plot actively (idiom)/scheming/calculating
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
committing all manner of crimes/completely unscrupulous
pinyin: wu2 suo3 bu4 yong4 qi2 ji2

definition: to take a lot of trouble (idiom); painstaking/at the cost of a lot of effort
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
to seek contact with sb for one's own benefit/to suck up to sb
to think through/to invest effort in thinking about/to consider thoroughly
